definitions.definition: To endeavour to depress the price of, or prices in.
To carry or convey, literally or figuratively.
definitions.example: Judging from the look on his face, he wasn't bearing good news.

definitions.definition: To support, keep up, or maintain.
To produce, yield, give birth to.
(originally nautical) To be, or head, in a specific direction or azimuth (from somewhere).
definitions.example: By my readings, we're bearing due south, so we should turn about ten degrees east.

definitions.definition: Of a beam, column, or other device, carrying weight or load.
A mechanical device that supports another part and/or reduces friction.
The horizontal angle between the direction of an object and another object, or between it and that of true north; a heading or direction.

definitions.example: That has no bearing on this issue.
She walks with a confident, self-assured bearing.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) Direction or relative position.
That part of any member of a building which rests upon its supports.
definitions.example: A lintel or beam may have four inches of bearing upon the wall.

definitions.definition: The portion of a support on which anything rests.

definitions.example: The beam has twenty feet of bearing between its supports.

definitions.definition: Any single emblem or charge in an escutcheon or coat of arms.
